summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to FBI personnel, dated July 4, 2019. It discusses logistical planning for serving subpoenas on 10 initial approach individuals in the Epstein investigation, including Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, Leslie Groff, and Leslie Wexner. The email attaches the subpoenas and coordinates a meeting time.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Recipient of the email from the Assistant U.S. Attorney, involved in coordinating the service of subpoenas related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: One of the 10 initial approach individuals listed for subpoena service in the Epstein investigation, as indicated in the attached file name.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: One of the 10 initial approach individuals listed for subpoena service in the Epstein investigation, as indicated in the attached file name.

persons.name: Leslie Groff
persons.context: One of the 10 initial approach individuals listed for subpoena service in the Epstein investigation, as indicated in the attached file name.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: One of the 10 initial approach individuals listed for subpoena service in the Epstein investigation, as indicated in the attached file name.

connections.description: Both are listed among the 10 initial approach individuals targeted for subpoena service in the same investigative action, indicating they are subjects of interest in the same case.
The AUSA is emailing Byrne to coordinate the service of subpoenas and schedule a meeting, indicating a law enforcement collaboration on the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned subpoena service
events.description: Subpoenas for 10 initial approach individuals, including Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, Leslie Groff, and Leslie Wexner, are prepared and dated for potential service on or after Friday, July 5, 2019.

events.title: Coordinated meeting
events.description: A meeting is being scheduled between the Assistant U.S. Attorney and FBI personnel (Paul Byrne) for Monday, July 8, 2019, to discuss the investigation and potentially supplement information if an arrest hasn't occurred.

keyFacts: On July 4, 2019, an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the SDNY was coordinating with the FBI to serve subpoenas on 10 initial approach individuals in the Epstein investigation.
The list of individuals targeted for subpoena service included Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, Leslie Groff, and Leslie Wexner.
The subpoenas were dated for July 5, 2019, and could be used anytime on or after that date, indicating imminent investigative action.
The email discusses contingency planning around a potential arrest, suggesting active investigative steps were underway.
The correspondence shows close coordination between federal prosecutors and the FBI in building the case.
